lenders.name: BuYousef
lenders.loan_because:
This is no longer our money.  We have a religious obligation to take out a portion of our income every year and pay it to people in need.  The money we have with Kiva is our accumulated charity donations since 1998.

We believe these loans make better use of the same money by recycling it.  We will keep re-lending in the hope it benefits more and more people.

Our goal is to diversify our charity donations and distribute them to different people and businesses around the globe.

We wish you all the best in your ventures.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: it is, in my opinion, the best and most proactive way to eradicate poverty in the world.  these individuals and groups do not just need food and clothing given to them thru charity--though this is an honorable and important supplement to help those in poverty along the journey.  we need to concurrently and primarily help enable the impoverished to become self-sufficient so that they may be freed of the need for charity, so they may flourish and provide for their families no longer with the help of others.  you truly cannot go wrong by lending in the form of microcredit to those who will truly do good and make the most of this money.

lenders.name: David
lenders.occupation: State Coordinator, campaign for US Dept. of Peace
lenders.loan_because: The meaning of true wealth is to me energy exchanged in relationships, and only has value when it is alive and moving.  Money has nothing to do with it, money is inert, the feces-trail of activity that has passed on.  And, this is the kicker:  all of our energy is a gift, freely given without conditions.  How we use our energy in this moment determines our true wealth.
lenders.occupational_info: World peace will arrive when we feel that we belong to all people, and they belong to us.  My primary task is to empower people to walk their talk, and to do that I need to be walking, myself.  Towards that end I reach out to others through speaking and writing, and I reach into myself to become a better person.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.occupational_info:
I do my best in helping Veterans across the board in the areas of business thoughts, ventures, start-up direction, etc...

As a Disable Vet, I've been through the wind mill. Nevertheless, as a Country Man I can not stand down while our Country is failing. Furthermore, and yes this may sound crazy, and some have told me that this venture could jeopardize my benefits but I'm still at Awe and I'm still standing on the sound principles that brought this Country to it greatness. Some of those same principles I feel will ensure a well deserve ticket in which you must accomplish. Therefore below, I've listed a number of matters that will add to your on going goals. Also, I do ask that you please forgive me for not responding sooner. I strive in pray before I move on any notation. Thus, I earnestly feel that the prays in which I sought have been answered. Grade for : Week 4 Team A 
Numeric grade: 20/20 pts. Letter Grade:  
Comments:
You were clearly a great team player this week! You really accomplished TCO 5: 'Given a problem situation to be solved by collaborative methods, participate in forming a team, developing its plan of attack, and establishing its rules and norms.' The work with your team in each week really gives a practical, hands-on experience developing team and decision-making strategies that you can use in future school and work teams! Keep up the great work, 

School Paper:

The fundamental purpose of "Integrate" is to supply Veterans and Disable Veterans with a firm support of Education, Franchise, Businesses, Entrepreneurship and Finances. "Integrate" over all core purpose and goals are too, 'Pursue Change, Produce Growth and to Provide Opportunity in the Global Market Place. Within "Integrate" mission, each successful individuals will produce a 501(c)3 charitable organization that will give 10% of all earnings back to "Integrate" charitable mission. This process will reproduce the growth of new Veterans that is seeking to improve the livelihood of their Community, State, and finally the Global Market. Within the 10% GP "Give Back' program, "Integrate" will also provide regular funding and proceeds to the Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Medical Centers, Department of Defense and the Social Security Administration. 
 
At "Integrate" we diversity in leadership, giving each administration the opportunity to lead. This function would insure that each individual have the ability to run any giving position in any giving situation. Furthermore, 'structural' management will give different version and vision of leadership and the ability to foreseen the opportunity of multi managerial skills and contingencies for stargazing profound measures of development for Global Market success.

  I. "Code of conduct and expected behavior":

A). Team members must respond in a ethical manner.
B). Team members must not control other team members with unethical means.
C). Team members are required to act professionally while in the discussing their team work.
D). All members must show ethical values to other team members.
E). All members must complete the weekly assignments in a respectable time frame.
  
  I. "Team Rules":

A). All team members are required to participate while on the team.
B). All team members are required to complete all weekly assignments of that week.
C). All team members are required in providing a excuse when they return to the team.
D). All team members are required to post at least one type of contact information.
E). All team members are required to vote on a leader and provide a rotation order 
      by September 29, 2008.
F). All team members must assist another team member if asked too.
G). All team members must show good faith to other team members.
H). All team members must provide at least two post on the topic at hand from the library.
I). All team members must not disrespect another team member because of their response.
J). All team members must vote and chose a time in which we will meet by September 29, 2008.

  II. "Communication Plan":

A). All members must submit a vote on the location of a meeting place by September 29, 2008. Week 5 meeting is schedule to start September 30, 2008. In the event that agreement isn’t made, meeting will be held in the University chat room, 7:00 to 7:30 Easter Standard Time.
B). All members is required to communicate in the discussion board Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday of week 5 no later then 11:59 Mountain Time.
C). All members are required to finish their team post by Friday each week not later then 11:59 MT

   III. "Team Strategy":

A). "Team A", strategy for week five will consist of a "Structural Management Format" rotating each team member everyday until the completion of the assignment. Each member will be responsible for his or her work load. Listed below is the Leadership Order:

Director: xxxxxxx xxxxx, until September 30, 2008
CEO: myself, until September 30, 2008        
CFO: xxxxx xxxxxxx, until September 30, 2008
President Marketing: xxxxxx xxxxxx, until September 30,2008
President Sales: xxxxxxx xxxxxx, until September 30, 2008
President Distribution: xxxxx xxxx, September 30, 2008

xxxxxxx xxxxx, will then go to the bottom as Presidents, of Distribution and the personal in 'Distribution' will go to 'Sales'. The 'Sales personal will go to 'Marketing' and Marketing will go to 'CFO' and 'CFO' will go to 'CEO' and 'CEO' will be Director. This is our "Structural Personal Format". This formation will continue where left off for the following week/s. 
 
 IV. "Management Conflict Resolution":

A). In case of a disagreement or conflict between team members. The acting team leader "Director" will provide a resolution for the matter. If by any means the "Director" can't resolve the matter he or she should file a discussion report to the team members on 'Team A' discussion board. All members would then vote on a resolution to resolve the matter at hand. 
 
  V. "Team Goals":

A). "Integrate" 'structural' management operation, provides the essence of lively-hood for the stakeholder, stock holder, employees, as well as the community and Global Market. It is our goal to help the formal military member as well as other 'Government Agencies' for those purposes. Each administration personal at "Integrate" is equipped to operate and run t he entire company from a main stream of "Portals" in the event of unforeseen matters. 


Introduction and Letter to the VA

It’s often said in life, you take what you’re given and you make the best of it. I believe that now is my time to make something great. 

As a disabled Veteran, I’ve seen the harms of life take their toll on me, as well as on many other service disabled soldiers. However, I’ve also empowered myself, and enabled myself to adopt a plan of action for improving my own livelihood, as well as that of others. To that end, today that is my philosophy, to continue a life of helping others the best way I am able.

To this end, I request funding to start-up a multifaceted, Web-based communications service, which I intend to explain over the following pages. I am certain you will see that I have developed a keen business plan, a strong philosophy, and a feasible approach to initiating this plan.

My anticipated outcome includes the following benefits:

	Assist the VA in its support of my livelihood and that of others

	Create a strong Veteran-owned Web business

	Enable me to work at home and prosper in a healthy environment

Over the past 5 years, I have invested myself in my business community, making contact with and educating myself on the business experience of key area professionals. Through this process, I have gained not only a strong entrepreneurial spirit and ability, but also I’ve gained access to a wealth of intellectual properties, including Web designers and coders, advertisers, attorneys, CPAs, bonding and licensing agents. I believe that equipped with the contacts and information I have available, I have been able to foster a strong business sense and acumen.

Serving Those in Need

Although some of the greatest men and women abroad have never been to the battle field, it is one of the greatest duties of life to serve and protect. This duty continues even after we return home. While personally my disability hinders me from being employed at a worksite, I can conquer this by doing what is needed from the friendly confines of my home office. I can continue to do a "Job Well Done" from my very location. 

In saying that, I only speak for myself. Others will strive to obtain the opportunities provided by entrepreneurs such as myself who and established thru the very principles of the Department of Veteran Affairs and other government agencies. To that end, my goal is to provide a comprehensive set of services that will assist Veterans in connecting professionally in much the same way I was able to in my business community.

Furthermore, the goal of helping other Vets can be mostly achieved using the skills and abilities I have already accumulated. Put simply, I don’t need the VA to spend large amounts of resources in training and education. My business idea is viable and I have the skills and connections to accomplish it. 
I propose the following Web portals to be the flagship products of my business:

	Website 1: Resume portal
	Website 2: Self-Affirmations service
	Website 3: Innovation network -- community forum
	Website 4: Keyword Advertising and Marketing services

Brief descriptions of these programs along with their features and benefits are as follows:

Website 1: Online Resume Portal
Given current economic times, Veterans aren’t the only ones feeling the pressure of unemployment, so I believe a Website dedicated to providing resume writing, posting, and other job search services for job seekers would provide an important role in our society. Features of this Website would include access to professional writing services, video and audio job seeker presentations, links to employers and job boards, and other employment services.


Website 2: Self-Affirmation Services
Self help program featuring a program of healing, positive self-statements and other techniques you can purchase to help counter negativity and make a powerful change in your life. You take personal responsibility for your health and emotional stability by letting go of negative emotional baggage you have been carrying. Only then will you be able to deal with your life in a realistic and positive manner. This Website will prove to be a valuable, necessary destination for Veterans of war, as well as general citizens suffering the fallout from poor economic times.


Website 3: Innovation Network – Community Forum Site
This Website business will provide tools and resources for those looking to get their stories published a social networking destination. This user friendly format will feature blogs and community forums to connect those who have ideas with those who offer services such as ghost writing and publishing. This site will utilize a pay per use revenue model, which with prove simple and attractive to users.


Website 4: Keyword Advertising and Marketing Services
In today’s internet economy keyword advertising and marketing has quickly emerged as the primary advertising medium for businesses and individual business owners seeking increased exposure. This Website will provide crucial information as to its specific advantages, and will provide a step-by-step guide for helping companies increase sales and profits by employing popular online marketing techniques.


Establishing Charitable Opportunities

Over the long term of this program, I plan on establishing a 501(c)3 charitable organization which would enable me to give back proceeds of my business to the VA Medical Center. This would allow me to go full-circle and truly assist those in need, just as I received help in my life.

Summary

As a Veteran my job is never done. If you assist me, I will continue to serve and respect others with honor, commitment, and courage. I am committed to excellence and the fair treatment of others. 

Thank you again for your time and consideration of my earnest proposal to develop a Web-based business start-up. I know that I can make an immediate impact on my life, as well as in the lives of countless others seeking to move themselves forward.
 
I look forward to solidifying this relationship and beginning this mutually beneficial, opportunity. Please contact me today via-email at jpowell48@hotmail.com to further discuss how we can get into the business of helping others.


Sincerely,
